Zorvath, the Shadow King, Lord of the Twilit Dominion, devised a plan to test the mettle of this mortal paragon.
For in the Shadow King's realm, the currency was suffering, and he sought to amass riches beyond measure.
With a whispered incantation, he summoned the Winds of Adversity to howl across the realm, bearing the dark essence of the void.
In a grand assembly of celestial beings, in the Great Conclave of Elyon, the fate of Job was decreed: "Let us behold if mortal virtue can withstand the crucible of suffering."

Zorvath's dark essence seeped into the dreams of the celestial choir, and soon, the sons and daughters of Elyon, heavenly beings of light, began to debate the nature of humanity and its capacity for goodness.
With a subtle gesture, the very fabric of reality was altered, thus beginning the odyssey of Job's tribulations.
With calculating malice, he set in motion a series of calamities designed to strip Job of all worldly attachments, leaving him bereft of comfort and support.
For in the labyrinthine recesses of Zorvath's dark heart, a spark of envy flickered, fed by the reverence the celestial hierarchies bestowed upon Job.
He conjured forth a trio of dark emissaries: Malphas the Deceiver, the Whispering Wraith, and Xerxes the Tempter.
For in the heart of Zorvath burned an eternal flame of envy towards the celestial beings who had bestowed upon humanity the gift of free will.
